alert.note: Alert for Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 05 at 1:29PM PST until December 05 at 10:40PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: .Heavy rain will continue over the advisory area through tonight, slowly decreasing in intensity. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Washington, including the following counties, in northwest Washington, Grays Harbor, Island, Kitsap and Mason. In west central Washington, King, Lewis, Pierce, Snohomish and Thurston. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 128 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
